data.title: How many Oscars does Marlon Brando have and how many times has he been nominated for the Academy Awards?
data.meta_description: Marlon Brando was a monumental figure in the history of cinema, playing a series of iconic roles such as Vito Corleone in ‘The Godfather’.
data.text:
The history of cinema cannot be fully appreciated without acknowledging its landmark films and the luminaries who brought them to life. Marlon Brando stands as one of the most iconic actors in the annals of film, boasting an extensive and complete filmography that elevated his career to the ranks of the industry’s greatest.

Follow the 2024 Oscars ceremony and the red carpet latest updates live online on As.com.

Everything you need to know about the 2024 Oscars

As we approach the 96th edition of the Oscars, set to be held on March 10 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles, thoughts and memories resurface about the figures who have made significant marks on cinematic history and were recognized at these prestigious awards once or multiple times throughout their careers.

Marlon Brando, the American actor par excellence, is one such character who has managed to deeply resonate and leave a lasting impression on a significant portion of film enthusiasts. He took on roles that demanded the highest level of performance without compromising their integrity, achieving the recognition they deserved.

Marlon Brando made his big-screen debut in 1950 with the film ‘The Men’, and during that decade, he appeared in nearly one film per year. ‘On the Waterfront’, ‘Viva Zapata!’, and ‘Julius Caesar’ were among his earliest films and are listed among his most successful. Brando’s long career was acknowledged on numerous occasions, with awards for his roles totaling up to 32 times, including prestigious accolades such as four Golden Globes, an Emmy, and three BAFTAs.

How many Oscars does Marlon Brando have, in which categories did he win, and for which was he nominated?

Marlon Brando belongs to an iconic generation of actors that includes names like Jack Nicholson, Paul Newman, Robert De Niro, and Al Pacino. Among all his accolades, the most prestigious film awards, the golden statuettes, stand out. He was nominated for eight Ocars and won two. Here are all of Marlon Brando’s Oscar nominations and victories.

*Oscar wins in bold

Among his remarkable performances, his role in ‘The Godfather’ stands out as one of the greatest performances of all time, a masterpiece that has transcended generations without diminishing in stature. In this Francis Ford Coppola-directed film, Marlon Brando delivered one of the most memorable performances ever seen on the big screen. This was his magnum opus, which rightfully earned him the Oscar for Best Actor.
